title: Great app
text: Makes you conscious about opening an app or link. Works great as well

title: Love this app
text: Nothing more to add compared to the others - I just really love this app.

title: Lifetime subscription cancelled without any information - now they‘re requesting to subscribe again
text: Just that you be aware as well: I downloaded this app a little earlier and signed up for the lifetime subscription for which there was a promotion. I just wanted to do the setup on it today and got the paywall shown. When I tried to restore the plan it would still not show up. So technically, my lifetime subscription has been cancelled and I would have to subscribe once more for the same product which I found really upsetting.

title: Life saver
text: I’ve gained so much time to do stuff a actually want by adding this little timer to social media. For such a simple idea, it really works wonders.

title: Love
text: I just love this app so much really makes me so much happier. Couldn’t live without it

title: The Best
text: This is the best Screen Time app ever I’ve been looking for dozens of Screen Time app and I can tell you this is the best one.

title: Great App but Family Purchase Didn’t Share
text: Have been using this app for a while now so I decided to buy a lifetime family subscription but it is not syncing with others in my iCloud family. I tried to find a fix online but wasn’t able to find any solutions.

title: Helpful but too glitchy
text: This app is very helpful, but the way it works with shortcut automations and screen time make it glitchy. It constantly turns off my screen time and causes my apps to glitch out. I would like to use it, but I have found other apps like ScreenZen to do the same thing without the bugs that OneSec has. I enjoyed using it, but I deleted it after I got so annoyed at its problems.

title: Among other issues, breaks FB Messenger
text:
(Note, I attempted to send this via the dev’s chat option, but it wouldn’t go through. Suffice to say the whole thing needs major work before I’ll download and attempt to use again. Also, I’ve been testing the free version, was giving that a trial run before intended upgrade but not confident that would help at this stage.) 

Uninstalling because it’s causing weird problems with FB Messenger. Messages that I’ve sent from the FB page of any individual friend, that appear to have been successfully sent, are nowhere to be found when I later access Messenger by itself. I can’t tell if the messages are not, in fact, getting through, or whether I’m just not retaining a copy. This breaks the app, as far as I’m concerned.

title: Works, but not for all apps
text: I haves jigsaw app I’d like to block but it doesn’t show up on the list for the second selection step.

title: waste of time
text: I am not paying a subscription service that is THAT MUCH MONEY for ONE FEATURE THAT I WANT. (intentional app switching). I am 19 years old and have no money. Disappointed.

title: The ONLY app that helped cure my phone addiction
text: I’ve been using this app for about 6 months and have noticed my social media usage lower over time from 70-80 uses attempts per week to 10 or fewer. I never found success cutting out social media completely/blocking apps, because it just made me crave them more. This app does something that the others don’t, which is create friction rather than restriction. It promotes positive alternatives like journaling and breathing while allowing the user agency to choose the social media apps mindfully. I ended up using my Instagram so little after this (due to it not being as interesting/getting my attention back) that I deleted my account. This app is truly life changing, if you don’t mind the subscription price and the brief setup.

title: A great concept and currently a failure
text: This would be great. Exactly what I needed to manage my dumb brain. Except its function is completely unreliable. Works about 65% of the time and the rest of the time doesn’t actually do anything. No matter how many times I restart the phone and try again, nothing is blocked. Works fine again the next day. I am paying for this, so I really hope the developers fix this thing.

title: Burn Meta
text: Burn it! This app is great. 👌🏻

title: Changed my life
text: This is a great app period

title: Great app
text: This app has saved me so much time, I kove the productivity that i have been able to get back

title: works great, so far.
text: so far everything is working and it is definitely impacting how i use social media. i find that the use is much more intentional now. thanks! 5 stars if this pattern holds up, i've only had the app for 2 days

title: 有些app无法使用
text: 无法设置character.ai和spicychat😖😖😖不知道什么时候能搞定，但是真的很需要这两个app的设置权限！！！

title: Help
text: Edit: continually running into this problem. This app has been super helpful but I’ve run into an issue where I start a block session from the widget (24 hours in this case) and it keeps the onesec app from opening but has no effect on any other app such as instagram or tiktok. I’m unable to deactivate the block session to go into onesec and fix it.

title: Single-handedly solved my social media problem
text: Absolutely the best app for anyone that spends too much time on social media. I’ve tried pretty much every blocker available, even hard core shut down ones and nothing has worked like this app. The redirect breathing exercise is so annoying to go through every-time you open the app that it deters me and because you can enter the app afterwards I’m not tempted to go through the trouble of deactivating the mechanism. I solved my social media addiction with this app and while yes it may seem pricey, it’s still less expensive then other blocker apps that I’ve found to be far less effective so it’s worth it for me. I definitely recommend trying if you’ve tried blockers before and haven’t had success

title: Don’t buy - doesn’t work
text: I loved this app while it worked. But two days after buying it, it stopped showing up on the shortcuts app. I reached out the developers and they were unhelpful and made the problem worse. Supposedly this is an apple bug, but their app is the only third party affected by this bug. Don’t waste your time or money.

title: Yes
text: Please buy this! I’ve had One Sec for almost a year now, and it’s done exactly what I hoped. I am no longer the sorry result of human habit—mindlessly opening Instagram, scrolling, and wasting my precious life! I don’t usually write reviews, but THANK GOD for this!

title: The app is a lifesaver
text: This app has done a tremendous job helping me curb my phone addiction. The features are fun and it has great alternatives, but I am mostly impressed with its simplicity and ease of use. The instructions to setup are straightforward. Then, once it’s up and running, it helps me not spend too much time on my phone through prompts ahead of opening social media and through simple interruptions so I don’t spend too much time doing something without thinking. A 10/10 app.

title: Want to like…
text: I really love the concept of this app, but when I subscribed, I did not get the features promise. If I switch out of Tiktok for less than a minute to look up something or answer a text, then I have to sit to the prompt to get me back in even though I said it to give me a three minute break. I tried adjusting multiple settings, but I keep running into a problem when I try to save something I saw too my book list or make a note and it became too annoying.

title: Great app to break out of doomscrolling and help improve mental health!
text: I’ve used the pro version for two years, and it’s been a game changer. Being able to use one sec across different apps makes me become more mindful of my intentions of using the apps. Having some gentle reminders set up on the intervention screen (e.g., take a breath, stretch, drink some water) has also complemented what I learned from cognitive behavioral therapy. 100% would recommend trying one sec out!

title: Good app
text: More free. Manythanks!

title: App blocking delay
text: I hit block on the apps and sometimes I have to unblock and block again several times before it actually works!!! This is SO ANNOYING! Please fix this if it can be fixed!!!

title: Money Hungry Dev
text: They all start with the promise of free. Then they get big and start hiding formerly free features behind a pay screen. Why can’t I customize the intervention like I could in the past. Dev has added too many features that make the app unusable. Keep it simple. This app had a lot of potential but I can see it going down the drain like all the productivity apps before it.

title: I LOVE THISSSS!
text: At first, I used to have arroun 8 to 9 hours a day, maybe 6 of those hours, were mindles scrolling, so I decided to do something, look for apps that can make my screen time lower, and I found One Sec, at first, I didn’t have faith it was going to work, but the next day, from having 8 to 9 hours, I only have 4 hours, I know that’s still a lot, but my habit of mindles scrolling was gone! I really recommend this app to the person reading this, it gives you 1 month for free so, try it out!

title: very useful
text: i am very happy with using this amazing application! i am an actual and real addicted person to social media and i was using instagram and others more than 6 hours a day but with help of this app it reduced to less than 3 hours totally

title: Worth every penny!
text: This is the only app that has truly had an impact on reducing my doom scrolling and I’m so grateful!

title: What a joke
text: Absolutely comical that this app expects you to pay for a “breathing exercise” popup. Get real.

title: Great App! Having trouble with Lemon8
text: Love this app!! Has saved me so much time in life! I highly recommend it if you are struggling with spending significant time on certain apps! There is one issue that I am experiencing though. I am trying to build a new shortcut for “Lemon8” and  when I look for the app in the “App (must be selected ⚠️)” section, the “lemon8” app is not an option listed in the list. I am not sure if this is a One Sec problem or an Shortcuts problem but it is making it hard to use One Sec for this app.

title: Need ability to block more apps
text: Would like to be able to add a delay to enter settings, App Store, and Opal (another 3rd party screen time app)

title: Think twice before you open
text:
If they can lock down this beta mode where you don’t have to manually set it up through automation it will be a game changer! I am doing a social media fast every 23 hours & the beta version is assisting with it greatly. It stops me right in my tracks with a friendly reminder to do something more productive. It even groups app by category so it is easier to locate. 
If you think you can trick it by going to the website of a blocked app, it will also stop you there.  
It works best for me without the timer at the top counting down the hours.

title: Buggy
text: The app just doesn’t work properly for me. I did try the faqs but no luck in making this work, so it isn’t meant to be. The search continues.

title: stopped my tiktok addiction
text: stopped my tiktok addiction!!! i haven’t been on in a month!! i started listening to audiobooks and being more productive, thanks one sec!!

title: Actually Helps!
text: One sec has significantly reduced my YouTube addiction! I would highly recommend. However, there are a few bugs in the app, but there is really good support and they helped me solve them.

title: Great but…
text: Some apps didnt work like capcut. Otherwise works great!

title: Horrible don’t download
text: I downloaded this app and now it won’t let me delete it I can remove it from home screen but completely deleting it is impossible please do not download this app

title: Very kind
text: I love it so much

title: It works
text: I did the shortcut in settings and it works, what more is there to say, it’ll slow me down before i open something irrationally. Great idea 👏.

title: Very grateful I bought premium on One Sec
text: Crazy how these large corporations made social media apps so powerful that I'll subconsciously go on Instagram and snapchat without even thinking about it. I'm not a scroller and wouldn't endlessly scroll on social media but I would go on them to check notifications. Whenever there was pause in a video game, nothing going on in the moment in life, or I'm bored, I'd naturally pick up my phone and by default go to Instagram with 0 purpose. After I downloaded one sec and bought premium it made my unconscious habit conscious. It makes me ask myself in my head, "is there anything I absolutely need to do on this app?" If the answer is no, I get off. The habit has subsided too because my mind associates checking social media as one sec popping up. So grateful I got this because I'm a lot more mindful and in the moment than I was before and I'm a lot happier and less irritable. I highly recommend you get this app because if your someone like me who doesn't wanna delete their socials, this makes you in control of your decision to go on these high dopamine apps rather than the corporation being in control of you.

title: No better way to reduce screen time
text:
This app has seriously reduced the amount of time
I spend on my phone. Litterally nothing else works. Thank you guys so much

title: 5 of 5
text: Great app, it helps save time and is highly recommended if you want to spend less time on social media. However, I personally enjoy procrastinating on social media, so I don’t use it much. Regardless, it’s a solid app and deserves a 5/5 rating!

title: New update made me lose all my quotes
text: Love the app but all my custom quotes have been erased with the latest update. Really didn’t want to lose those…

title: Helpful, effective
text: Very helpful app to reduce impulsivity related to phone usage which is super important in the modern world where the phone and everything related to it is designed and backed by research/money to keep you addicted to it. Very thankful for this app.

title: Great app! Responsive customer service
text: I was really trying to curb my Instagram usage and this app helped! When I decided to finally delete Instagram off my phone, I no longer needed one sec. I messaged the company asking how to unsubscribe and they instantly sent me a tutorial of how to unsubscribe. I really appreciate this company’s commitment to its mission, seems like they really want to help people, not just sell stuff.

title: My favorite app of 2024
text: Every update this app gets something awesome to get your time back. The developer is very passionate about this project and it shows. The UI is beautiful and easy to follow. I love this app for making me super aware of my screen time and assisting with my discipline. Keep up the amazing work 🐐

title: Great app, but…
text: This is a very clever application that does precisely what it’s advertised to. It requires a form of intervention before opening an app of your choice, and this is highly customizable. There are lots of interventions to choose from, and how long you want them to be. You can also have it choose a random exercise for you, and it supports website blocking as well, which is nice. You can also set up a bedtime schedule where it blocks all apps and websites. It provides an informative dashboard detailing approximately how much time you saved. However, I really can’t get behind the modern era of subscription based apps. Especially for the lifetime license costing a whopping FIFTY dollars, and SEVENTY for a “family plan”. I don’t have any problem supporting independent developers and paying for software, but I personally feel like this is overpriced for what it does. Most of it is just relying on the iOS shortcuts functionality anyway, and all the app is doing is showing a pretty GUI and recording the time. You could replicate something similar in shortcuts (although not entirely, like website blocking for instance.) If you don’t mind the cost, go for it, but I would probably pay $15 maximum for a lifetime license, not $50. Especially considering many people using this are likely college students.

title: Doesn’t really work

One design flaw aswell is when I try to go safari it only lets me go to YouTube so it is hard for me to search stuff up. This is just my scenario though try it for yourself.

title: Just One Big Issue
text: At least for me, the blocking page kicks in a little too late and by that time, I’ve already gotten a glimpse of a social media or my email and figured whether people have texted me or if I have any notifications. In that sense the blocking simply doesn’t work. I still find the app helpful tho

title: Break your addiction!
text: This app is a great tool to break your addiction to social media. While it won’t prevent you from accessing social media apps, it will assist you in your healing journey.

title: Love the concept, doesn’t work properly
text: I love the idea of this app and in theory it’s very useful, but it just doesn’t work properly. Sometimes I can watch TikTok for 30 seconds before it triggers, and by that point I’m hooked. I’ve also tried to set up intentional app switching multiple times, that feature has never worked. I deleted it today, after a solid 6 months of trying it out and being disappointed.

title: Worth the money
text: Buy this app, it’s the only thing that’s helped me put any dent into my screen time at all, apple’s built in screen time monitors are a joke.

title: Add new apps
text: Hi can you add barstool to list of apps thst can be configured for automation? Thank you

title: Free version helped me kick mindless scrolling!!
text: This app is so so great!!  I am only using the free version, so I can’t comment on paid features, but I went from opening Instagram pretty much constantly any time there wasn’t something else to do to going up to two days without even thinking about opening it.  Since the free version only allows you to block one app, I’ve switched from using it to block Instagram to Twitter/X now, and even though one sec isn’t blocking Instagram anymore I’ve found that the desire to open it all the time is still gone.  This was way more effective for me than limiting my screen time on these apps through Apple’s settings.

title: Did not help
text: This app was really annoying because first it was really tricky and confusing to set up. Second, it made me pay for all the cool features. Lastly, it didn’t work very well and made me so annoyed that I deleted it.

title: Perfect! Now game-ify it
text: This app is great! The only one that’s helped me at all. My friends and I have started making it a competition and comparing our instagram attempts at night. If there was a social component where you could add friends and have a leaderboard…I would be excited.

title: Buena
text: Si

title: This crashes constantly.
text: This has never worked. Crashes constantly. Time sucker. Cancel before you are charged.

title: Great app but could use improvements!
text: Really cool idea for an app and I do think it has reduced my social media usage after just a few days. One improvement I would like to see is less of a delay to trigger the One Sec app after opening a social media app. Let’s say I open Instagram - sometimes it takes up to 10 seconds for One Sec to trigger a breathing break. That 10 second delay gives me the dopamine hit I was seeking by opening social media which is not ideal.

title: How do you use it?
text: I downloaded and watched a tutorial but I don’t really get it. I’m trying to destress, and this looks complicated. Just trying to find an app to help me detox that is simple.

title: Does not perform as advertised
text: I had high hopes for this app and bought into the lifetime plan option. I cannot express enough the absolute waste of $$ I invested in this product. As well as within 1hr of realizing this app could not perform as advertised I requested a refund which was denied. I have used apple for years and I’m really not sure how I was not able to receive a refund when I literally just bought it and IT DOES NOT WORK.

title: Why did you remove the progressive increment feature
text: This was literally the best feature and the whole reason i got the paid upgrade. I quit the paid version bc it was removed in an update and now whats even the point. Please put it back.

title: Most effective screen time app
text: I have tried so many methods for limiting my screen time over the years. Finally, FINALLY, this one works!! THANK YOU from a girl with ADHD. Only wish I had this in college.

title: W
text: Let’s me know every time that I open my app (TikTok)

title: Broke My TikTok Habit
text: I used this app to get rid of my compulsive TikTok use. I'm now using it to cut back on Facebook and Reddit as well. Great for your time management and mental health.

title: To the Designer
text:
I wanted to personally thank you for creating this app. Extremely useful, helpful, and I believe life changing. Kind of a big statement there, but for any of you who are wasting endless hours doom scrolling, this app has helped more than all of the personal promises I’ve made to myself and to God. What I needed was a second…in the moment…to think about what I was about to do. 

To be honest and vulnerable, here has been my pattern for probably a decade over the course of about a month…

Internet use for work
Boredom
Facebook 
Reels
Marketplace ….something suggestive 
Sexually…
Start fishing for suggestive material…
Outright porn searches 
Feel terrible…make promises to myself and God that Im not gonna do that again…

Feel good
Internet use for work
Boredom…

You get the cycle.

I bought the year subscription accidentally twice and the lifetime subscription, and I don’t even care.

It’s worth every penny.

I especially appreciate the journal portion.

Again, thank you.

title: Totally works
text: I thought it wasn’t going to change anything but it did, my time spent on social media has dropped drastically since I downloaded this app, it works every time. I am very thankful for this app. It was such a great idea inventing this app. I’ve recommended it to so many people because it has really helped me. At first it was annoying but that’s the whole point because it makes you not want to open the app.

title: Works great I hate it 😂
text: This does exactly what it sets out to do, it’s awesome and makes me so mad lol really good on rotating things, calling you out, really helps break habits. But I love that you can set how long you want to use the app. 5 mins goes faster than you think which is crazy how many times it has stopped me from doom scrolling once I finally get into the app. Seriously recommend this frustrating app it’s perfect

title: Very responsive to Feedback
text:
Thanks for adding the random text feature! I remember making a request about this awhile back and very glad to see it as an option for the intervention.

One suggestion would be to make the text length customizable.

Thanks for adding this!

title: Good for a shorter break but not a long-term fix
text:
I set the settings on the most extreme setting, for the longest pre-app pause. This helped me reduce my social media use—until I adapted to the pause. After a couple months, I realized my social media was right back where it used to be, but I was now also sinking extra time into the pauses. So I uninstalled. But I would still recommend this app for shorter breaks.

I also want to mention that the settings are complicated and hard to set up. I have a PhD, but this app made me feel intellectually limited because of how tricky the settings were. I have adhd, maybe it’s just not compatible with my brain. That said, the app creator very graciously walked me thru the settings and they clearly do want to help people figure it out (there are tutorials etc).

title: Fabulous
text: I love this app

title: Simple
text: It does what it says

title: wonderful app. nothing bad to say.
text: an idea for a feature: is it possible to turn the screen black and white during a scheduled block/when you open social media apps. i know there’s a way to do it through shortcuts but! it would be more seamless (i think) through here

title: Worthless
text: Worthless when you can easily delete the app and gain access to everything again. Forever lock means nothing.

title: Liked it but had down sides!!
text:
So i used One Sec, I thought like i will be able to like use an app for like 30 minutes then it would tell me to take a break. But that’s not true. And when I clicked block I thought it would block me going in the app. The app did the exact opposite. For the rest I guess it’s okay. But I suggest to get a different app.
AND I DON’T PAY FOR APPS !!!!!!!!!!!

title: A pop-up screen so annoying that it makes me hate this app
text: No, I’m not interested in “redeeming a free week.” I tried “setting up the app for 5 minutes,” an I’m still getting the annoying pop-up telling me to do the exact same thing when I open the app…over and over again. It’s so frustrating— just leave me alone and let me use the app for free. Maybe I’d rate it more highly if this were fixed. It’s just another lame gimmick attempt of a cash grab…

title: It does the job.
text: I’ve been using this app for about 3 months and it does the mf job. This app has made using instagram (and any other app if I click away too fast to avoid the loading screen) a HUGE inconvenience to open. I would rather do my college homework, touch grass, try hard drugs, or find the cure to cancer than wait for the dumb loading screen to boot up and give me time to “breathe”. So far I’ve saved 2 days of my life from instagrams parasitic grasp. Bravo!

title: Over 40 hours a week to under 28! That’s a part time job!
text: I bought One Sec at the beginning of the year and it’s given me the support I’ve needed to steadily decrease my social media usage.  It’s also helped me reframe my social media usage and take pause.  I love all the features, even if it is a bit of a process to fully customize everything (probably more on apple’s ios architecture and permissions than OneSec).  Do it do it do it! 20$ a year is literally 5cents a day, a nickel a day!! I will gladly pay a nickel to save 2 hours of my time daily

title: FREE TRIAL IS A LIE
text:
I genuinely wanted to try this app because of Ali Abdaal. I wasn’t sure if I wanted to purchase yet but I thought I might if I liked it after the “free” trial. 

Was immediately charged exactly $20.81 IMMEDIATELY the same day I downloaded the app and selected the “FREE TRAIL”!!!!

I WILL be reaching out to Apple to get a refund. Sad I was actually excited to use the app now I’ll just be deleting it.

title: Slow updates, morning journal broken with no way around
text: Horrible guardrailing against apple glitches. Morning journal will randomly appear throughout the day. The ‘reset screen time API’ switch is buried deep in the settings, making it unnecessarily difficult to find. It would make way too much sense to include a deep link to this or at least present the option when opening the app after an intervention. The recovery process is a nightmare, and app glitches become even more frustrating because of it. Fix this, and maybe it could be usable, but right now it’s painful.

title: Charged me $55?!
text: I just download this app and while setting it up it asked if you want to try a free trial for one year for $19.99 with one week free, so I continued, and I immediately saw a $54 charge from Apple for this app. I’m now having to dispute discharge because I definitely did not sign up for any $54 plan. Be careful when signing up. I’m so confused because I didn’t even see any $54 plan option.

title: Genuinely life changing - try try try it
text:
Never in my life have I written a review for an app but I’ve tried every single thing to stop using Instagram (but still wanted to have it in my phone so I can use once in a while) and nothing worked. I deleted the app then used it on Safari (terrible interface so assumed I couldn’t possibly get addicted) and then used it sm I had to block the website on my phone. If I ever redownloaded Instagram I’d once more use it so so much. 

With One Sec, the little number of times opened in 24hrs and the x hours since last opened have an insane grip on me like I don’t want to see that number over like 1-2 times ever. So then I started like being more conscious about when I opened the app bc I don’t want to ‘waste’ my app opens (ex if Im switching between apps or have to leave the house in 5 mins not worth it).

Now I’m opening Instagram just a couple times a week and just don’t feel the need to go on it much more. Anyways rant but so so good at least give it a try if you’ve ever wanted to use any app less you have nothing to lose.

title: Solid App - Missing Tools for Someone Like Me
text:
I’m glad to have this app for sure. The features are useful and it does help me stay on task.

I would love to be able to set an automated schedule of strict blocks and the ability to lock myself out of changing the settings.

My issue is not motivation so much as my responsible side needing to my procrastinating, distracted side from changing what the app allows.

Redirecting or motivating myself to keep working instead of scrolling social media just doesn’t work for me though I wish it did. I need to be able to lock myself out with the only key being hard to reach.

Thanks for all the hard work and the useful app!

title: Sadly not available
text: I have struggled with doomscrolling and finally decided to do something about it with this app. Come to find that even though it is advertised as free, it’s only a week trial. I only wanted help but I can’t afford to pay extra fees. If you’re wanting something to help stay off your phone and you have money I’m sure this is great but to anyone else then the search continues

title: Thank god this exists

A great tool for the distraction age.

title: Doesn't support all apps
text: It's frustrating that this app relies on a shortcut automation that won't work for ALL apps you may want to limit. If you are trying to activate One Sec on a less popular/well known app, you will likely not be able to set the automation to return you to that app (making the shortcut incomplete and making One Sec impossible to use on it).

title: Doesn’t work with Widgets
text:
If you have widgets and a limit on safari, every time you open an app with a widget icon one sec’s limits will go off. 

If you don’t specifically have widgets and have a limit set on safari, I imagine it works very well. But for me this didn’t work.

It’d be nice if widgets and one sec were able to work simultaneously together.

title: I hate it it fixed me.
text: Download this app if you want to actually stop scrolling - free version is limited but works great. But now I don’t wait time on social media so I actually have to be productive….

title: Love it but..
text: I really love this app and it helped me get off of Instagram a lot, however, after a certain point it started acting weirdly (I believe it was once I started using the reintervention feature), but the breathing screen would keep popping up while I was on the app to the point where it was super annoying, even when I had given myself 5 minutes, it would show up way earlier than that. It just got really frustrating when I was trying to text people for school related things/productive reasons, and I just wish there was a way to reset it 😭😭😭 I tried deleting and remaking the shortcut but it didn’t seem to work so I’m trying to redownload the app in hopes that it’ll fix itself.

title: I’ve tried them all, this is the best
text: I don’t ever write reviews on apps but this app is so good i have to. Personally have been trying to find an app like this one that would help with doom scrolling. None of the apps o have downloaded previously I have kept because they either didn’t work to break my habit or would cost money. But this one actually works by actually forcing you to take a break. And the most important feature of the app is free! Honestly can see myself spending the money on premium with how great of an experience I am having with it.

title: Strict but kind
text: This app is like a strict teacher! It makes you focus on your work by putting away your phone. It’s very precise and intelligent to select the important applications for you. So you won’t be bothered during your work.

title: Great idea, but not well executed
text:
This app has honestly helped me curb my Instagram usage so much! I didn’t realize just how often I’ve been opening the app out of almost subconscious habit, but having this tool has helped me realize that I don’t have a good reason and I’m losing a lot of life I’d rather live.

They have a few other features, but the main one I downloaded the app for - the intervention - has to be set up one app at a time (so won’t block new games), and and worse yet, you can only set up interventions for a limited list of common entertainment apps. If you’re getting stuck on anything but the most popular games and social medias, this app can’t help.

Additionally, the app itself is confusing and difficult to navigate. All the possible features and integrations are in one big list, and it’s usually unclear what each thing does without a lot of experimentation. Having the main features highlighted with “enhancing features” as sub-parts, or having a tutorial that walks through all the main things you can do with the app, would be a lot easier.

title: Difficult setup
text: I tried about half dozen iterations to set this up (even read the email instructions and watched a youtube video), got one of two outcomes: a “shortcuts” notification which is too small to read and disappears when you click it, or the one sec app opens to its main tab (not the blank take-a-breath screen). I did notice that the FAQ link in the email directs to tutorials, not a traditional FAQ - and that was my “give-up” point. This is probably a great tool for a young mind with a little current coding knowledge, but as a 56 year old whose programming days were in Pascal, the “shortcut” settings were too squishy for me. I will probably try this again in a few years. Two stars because I suspect majority of blame lies with Apple, not these developers.

title: One sec
text: Easy to use and its effective

title: Life Changing
text: Got this app a couple weeks back as I realized I was addicted to some mobile games and youtube. Seriously life changing, my screen time is down 50% consistently because of this app, I actually have time on my hands now. Hands down the best restriction app I have ever used. I dont even have the Pro version and it made a crazy difference! Thank you for this app, developers!

title: Extremely Helpful
text: Thank you for making this app, as an ADHD person working from home this is super helpful.

title: Probably effective but ultimately annoying
text: I don’t mind the delay in opening the chosen app but I COULD not stand that if you navigate away at all, turn timer off/get text, etc it pops up again. Like when I’m in it-just let me be-if I close and go back sure pop up.

title: Life changing
text: No hyperbole, one sec has completely changed my life. I have my life back. I’m present!

title: The perfect screen time app exists?
text:
One Sec is just amazing… 

Come for the “interventions”, but stay for the extras (like “healthy alternatives” where you choose apps or activities that you SHOULD be doing [like calling your mom] instead of doom-scrolling, is a killer feature and one I’ve wanted for years). They work so synergistically with the main features in a way that takes my ADHD in a way I had given up on…

At first I thought that the extra steps to set up Shortcuts was too wonky, but having used other Screen Time API apps that stop working or mistakenly block you from your apps, now I realize how genius it is and how it works WITH the iOS screen time instead of around it.

My only regret is that I didn’t get the lifetime plan right off the bat…

title: Thank you
text: I just wanted to say thanks for developing such an effective app. Amazing how taking a breath instead of just launching into whatever really helps you stay mindful. The schedule blocker is my favorite. If I absolutely need to get into an app, the controls are buried enough to make it inconvenient (therefor not habit forming) but possible to access an app. Great work! Grateful for getting piece of mind and time back. You’re making a difference, thank you.

title: Good app
text: It’s a long process to set it up but otherwise it’s a good app

title: couldnt use but concept is great
text: so i really like the idea of this app but the apps i struggle with arent on the list for the set up, and i dont see a way to add them?

title: So frustrating it’s great!
text: Not a long-term review I had this in place for about a day. I found myself so frustrated that I couldn’t get my fix of social media without going through something in order to get it. I didn’t realize how addicted to social media I am this app is amazing.

title: Life changing - truly rewires your habits
text: I don’t usually write reviews but one sec has changed my life! I thought I would get used to it and fall back into mindlessly opening apps for hits of dopamine, but over a year in and I truly don’t open my social apps without explicit intent anymore and have saved countless hours of my life.

title: WARNING: THE “FREE WEEK” IS NOT A TRIAL!
text:
I signed up for the free week to give it a shot. It immediately charged me $20 through Apple for a year subscription. 

They intentionally didn’t use the word “trial.” But when an app says you can try an app for “a free week,” there is an expectation you won’t be charged until after the week is up. 

It’s not even about the money. I felt manipulated. I deleted the app without even trying and am requesting a refund from Apple.

title: First open… blocked :)
text: Disclaimer: I haven’t used it for more than 5 minutes, so this is not a full app review, just a functionality issue I had. The idea for this app is brilliant. I was exploring to see how one sec worked, and clicked “block”. Now I am required to wait until the block is over to choose the apps I wanted to block. When I try to pause the block, it says I don’t have any apps selected so it won’t affect my phone use. I was hoping to get back to the app, but it’s impossible until the timer is up. I hope that this will be a simple fix; if there are no apps being blocked, the user should be able to pause the block to return to the app.

title: A great app that shows great promise
text:
I’m a student who has been struggling with procrastination for as long as I can remember. My phone, through social media and video games, has often been my source of that. I’ve tried other screen time apps in a desperate attempt to fix my problem, but all of them are easy to bypass and default back to wasting time. I was afraid that I would never be able to break the cycle. 

One Sec is the only program that forces you to reflect. And I mean, really, it forces you to reflect on yourself before you open the app that you designed. There’s nothing fancy about it - no bells and whistles like the other apps. That’s because change doesn’t come with bells and whistles, it comes from within. I’ve been using One Sec for only a day and I’ve managed to drop my average screen time about an hour and a half. It’s incredible, and I’m really giddy about how much I’ve been able to improve myself in only a day.

That being said, the downside of One Sec is that it doesn’t have any bells and whistles. You have to manually implement the shortcuts for all of the apps you want to block, and that is the meat and potatoes of this app - you don’t get much else that significantly helps you stop overusing apps. On top of that, the dashboard (overview) page of the app has very little content besides the list of apps that you blocked by hand and how much time you’ve saved through using One Sec (which seems inaccurate as I tend to spend a lot more time than three minutes every time I clicked on an app). 

But overall, this app is a great program that can help you beat overuse. More content and programs are sure to come as this app is just beginning, and I really look forward to it. I think that there are a lot of great things that can happen with this app, such as more content being added to the overview page (overall screen time, usage trend graphs, times you’ve continued to use the app despite the One Sec timer, etc) and making it easier to block apps. I’m very happy with One Sec and would recommend it to anyone looking to make a change for the better.
